info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:29PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark County through 300 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Wolf Creek, or 26 miles northwest of Helena, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Small hail may accumulate given the slow storm motion. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Lewis and Clark County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
